019
020import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
021
022/**
023 * SchedulerProvider represents a bridge between the core and the implementation's scheduling
024 * system.
025 *
026 * @param <C> Represents the implementation's {@link Chore} object.
027 *
028 * @author creatorfromhell
029 * @since 0.1.2.0
030 */
031public abstract class SchedulerProvider<C extends Chore<?>> {
032
033  protected final ConcurrentHashMap<Integer, C> chores = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
034
035  /**
036   * Used to create a task, which will execute after the specified delay.
037   *
038   * @param task        The task to run.
039   * @param delay       The delay, in ticks.
040   * @param environment The execution environment for the task.
041   */
042  public abstract void createDelayedTask(Runnable task, ChoreTime delay, ChoreExecution environment);
043
044  /**
045   * Used to create a task, which repeats after a specified period.
046   *
047   * @param task        The task to run.
048   * @param delay       The delay to run the task, in ticks.
049   * @param period      The period to run the task.
050   * @param environment The execution environment for the task.
051   *
052   * @return The associated {@link Chore} with this task.
053   */
054  public abstract C createRepeatingTask(Runnable task, ChoreTime delay, ChoreTime period, ChoreExecution environment);
055
056  /**
057   * Used to create a task, which repeats after a specified period.
058   *
059   * @param task   The task to run.
060   * @param delay  The delay to run the task, in ticks.
061   * @param period The period to run the task.
062   *
063   * @return The id, or -1 if no id can be returned.
064   */
065  public int createRepeatingTaskID(Runnable task, ChoreTime delay, ChoreTime period, ChoreExecution environment) {
066
067    return createRepeatingTask(task, delay, period, environment).id();
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Used to cancel a task.
072   *
073   * @param id The id of the task to cancel.
074   */
075  public void cancelTask(final int id) {
076
077    if(chores.containsKey(id)) {
078      chores.get(id).cancel();
079      chores.remove(id);
080    }
081  }
082}
